clinical_study.brief_title: Contributing Factors in the Pathobiology of Airway Remodeling in Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Contributing Factors in the Pathobiology of Airway Remodeling in Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: There are two aims for this study. The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of body weight and hormones on airway fibrosis (scarring) and lung function in obese & lean asthma subjects compared to obese & lean non-asthma subjects (Aim 1). And in obese subjects with asthma undergoing bariatric surgery compared to obese non-asthma subjects undergoing bariatric surgery (Aim 2).

primary_outcome.description: Obese asthmatics compared to lean asthmatics, obese non-asthmatics and lean non-asthmatics: A univariate linear model will be constructed to measure the effect of leptin or GLP-1 on airway fibrosis, as measured by the ratio of Masson's trichrome-stained area to non-stained area in the sub-mucosal region of airway biopsy tissue.

Asthmatics undergoing bariatric surgery and non-asthmatics undergoing bariatric surgery: Each patient will serve as its own control in comparing pre- and post-operative airway fibrosis. A univariate linear model will be constructed to measure the effect of bariatric surgery on airway fibrosis, as measured by the ratio of Masson's trichrome-stained area to non-stained area in the sub-mucosal region of airway biopsy tissue.

biospec_descr.textblock: blood plasma, bronchoscopy with endobronchial biopsy and bronchoalveolar, RNA

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be recruited from the clinics of the Duke Asthma, Allergy and Airway Center and the Duke Metabolic and Weight Loss Surgery Center, Healthy controls without lung disease will be recruited from the surrounding area

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Obese asthmatic & lean asthmatic
1. Outpatient adults of either sex 18-60 years of age with an initial asthma diagnosis at < 12 years of age, as defined by the NHLBI NAEPP guidelines.
2. Lean subjects with body mass index (BMI) < 30 or obese subjects with BMI ≥ 30.
3. Reversibility after 4 puffs inhaled albuterol of 12% in either forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) or forced vital capacity (FVC).
4. Negative pregnancy test in women of childbearing potential (confirmed during screening).
5. Stable obstructive sleep apnea.
6. Relatively healthy subjects able to undergo bronchoscopy without complications.
7. Willing and able to give informed consent and adhere to visit/protocol schedules.
8. Read and write in English.
Obese non-asthmatic & Lean non-asthmatic
1. Outpatient adults of either sex 18-60 years of age.
2. Lean subjects with body mass index (BMI) < 30 or obese subjects with BMI ≥ 30.
3. Negative pregnancy test in women of childbearing potential (confirmed during screening).
4. Stable obstructive sleep apnea.
5. Normal lung function.
6. No clinical history of atopy.
7. No significant medical or psychological issues.
8. Healthy subjects able to undergo bronchoscopy without complications.
9. Willing and able to give informed consent and adhere to visit/protocol schedules.
10. Read and write in English.
Asthmatic undergoing bariatric surgery
1. Outpatient adults of either sex 18-60 years of age with an initial asthma diagnosis at < 12 years of age, as defined by the NHLBI NAEPP guidelines.
2. Reversibility after 4 puffs inhaled albuterol of 12% in either FEV1 or FVC.
3. Morbidly obese subjects undergoing gastric bypass or sleeve gastrectomy and receiving care at the Duke Metabolic and Weight Loss Surgery Center.
4. Negative pregnancy test in women of childbearing potential (confirmed during screening).
5. Stable obstructive sleep apnea.
6. Relatively healthy subjects able to undergo bronchoscopy without complications.
7. Willing and able to give informed consent and adhere to visit/protocol schedules.
8. Read and write in English.
Non-Asthmatic undergoing bariatric surgery
1. Outpatient adults of either sex 18-60 years of age.
2. Morbidly obese subjects undergoing gastric bypass or sleeve gastrectomy and receiving care at the Duke Metabolic and Weight Loss Surgery Center.
3. Negative pregnancy test in women of childbearing potential (confirmed during screening).
4. Stable obstructive sleep apnea.
5. Normal lung function.
6. No clinical history of atopy.
7. No significant medical or psychological issues.
8. Healthy subjects able to undergo bronchoscopy without complications.
9. Willing and able to give informed consent and adhere to visit/protocol schedules.
10. Read and write in English.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Children < 18 years of age.
2. Adults ≥ 18 years of age with an initial asthma diagnosis at ≥ 12 years of age, as defined by the NHLBI NAEPP guidelines.
3. Inpatient status.
4. Post-bronchodilator FEV1 < 50% predicted.
5. Upper or lower respiratory tract infection within one month of the study.
6. Use of inhaled or systemic corticosteroids, leukotriene modifiers and/or theophylline preparations within four weeks of study.
7. Use of long-acting beta-2, GLP-1R agonists, or dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitors within two weeks of study.
8. Smoking history > 5 pack years or any cigarette use within the previous six months.
9. Significant non-asthma pulmonary disease (stable obstructive sleep apnea is not excluded).
10. Patients being treated medically for diabetes.
11. Positive pregnancy test for women and/or nursing women.
12. An ED visit or inpatient admission for a primary respiratory diagnosis or treatment with antibiotics within 60 days of enrollment.
13. Poorly controlled concomitant conditions that pose additional procedure risk as determined by the investigator.
